comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Miss Kathryn N. Steele, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Steele, was a debutante in 1913, introduced at a dance in Westbury, Long Island, attended by over 300 guests. She married Francis Skiddy Von Stade Sr. (1884-1967), and they had at least four children (Dolly, Skiddy Jr., Frederick, and Charles). Skiddy Sr. was a polo player. This is about their house: www.oldlongisland.com/2011/09/f-skiddy-von-stade-estate.html Her son Skiddy Jr. was a Harvard administrator for many years: www.thecrimson.com/article/1972/9/1/f-skiddy-von-stade-pb... Opera singer Frederica Von Stade is Kathryn Steele's granddaughter. The woman next to her could be an older sister, she had two: Nancy Steele Milburn and Eleanor, who was married to a French count. Here's Nancy elsewhere in the stream: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4408110059/] The next photo in the stream confirms that the second woman is Nancy Milburn: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/7177688778/]

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The next photo appears to be the original from which this one was cropped. Both Steele sisters married prominent polo players. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E05E2D91631E733A...
